title: Learn Reinforcement Learning Basics
description: Understand the fundamental concepts and algorithms of reinforcement learning to a level where I can implement and experiment with simple RL agents.

subgoals.title: Understand Core RL Concepts
subgoals.description: Grasp the foundational concepts of RL, including agents, environments, rewards, states, actions, policies, and value functions.

tasks.description: Define Agent, Environment, State, Action, and Reward
Explain the concept of a Policy
Define Value Function (V) and Q-Function (Q)
Differentiate between Markov Decision Processes (MDPs) and non-MDPs
Explain the concepts of Exploration vs. Exploitation

subgoals.title: Learn about Key RL Algorithms
subgoals.description: Gain knowledge of fundamental RL algorithms and their underlying principles.

tasks.description: Study Q-learning algorithm
Study SARSA (State-Action-Reward-State-Action) algorithm
Study Policy Gradients (e.g., REINFORCE)
Understand the difference between on-policy and off-policy learning
Explore Deep Q-Networks (DQNs) at a high level (optional)

subgoals.title: Implement Simple RL Agents
subgoals.description: Develop practical experience by implementing RL agents for basic environments.

tasks.description: Set up a development environment with necessary libraries (e.g., Python, OpenAI Gym/Gymnasium, TensorFlow/PyTorch)
Implement a Q-learning agent for a simple environment (e.g., FrozenLake)
Implement a SARSA agent for a simple environment (e.g., FrozenLake)
Experiment with different parameters (learning rate, discount factor, exploration rate) and observe their effect on performance
Document the implementations and experiments

subgoals.title: Understand Evaluation Metrics
subgoals.description: Learn how to evaluate the performance of RL agents.

tasks.description: Define episodic return and average return
Explain how to measure and compare the performance of different RL agents
Understand the importance of proper evaluation techniques

title: Learn Reinforcement Learning Basics
description: Gain a foundational understanding of Reinforcement Learning concepts and principles.

subgoals.title: Understand Core Reinforcement Learning Concepts
subgoals.description: Learn the fundamental building blocks of RL, including agents, environments, states, actions, rewards, and policies.

tasks.description: Define and differentiate between agents, environments, states, actions, and rewards.
Explain the concept of a policy and its role in decision-making.
Describe the Markov Decision Process (MDP) and its properties.
Understand the exploration-exploitation dilemma.
Learn about value functions (V(s) and Q(s,a)) and their significance.

subgoals.title: Explore Different Types of Reinforcement Learning Algorithms
subgoals.description: Become familiar with common RL algorithms, including value-based, policy-based, and actor-critic methods.

tasks.description: Research and compare value-based methods like Q-learning and SARSA.
Investigate policy-based methods like REINFORCE and Actor-Critic methods.
Understand the differences and trade-offs between these different types of algorithms.
Identify the appropriate algorithm for different problem types.

subgoals.title: Implement Basic RL Algorithms in a Simple Environment
subgoals.description: Gain practical experience by implementing simple RL algorithms in a simulated environment (e.g., Gridworld or OpenAI Gym environments).

tasks.description: Choose a simple RL environment (e.g., Gridworld, CartPole).
Implement a Q-learning algorithm to solve the chosen environment.
Implement SARSA algorithm to solve the chosen environment.
Evaluate the performance of the implemented algorithms.
Experiment with different hyperparameters to optimize performance.

subgoals.title: Learn about Exploration Strategies
subgoals.description: Study and implement different techniques for exploring the environment effectively to improve learning.

tasks.description: Understand the concept of epsilon-greedy exploration.
Learn about Boltzmann (Softmax) exploration.
Implement and compare epsilon-greedy and Boltzmann exploration strategies in a simple environment.
Research other exploration techniques, such as upper confidence bound (UCB).

subgoals.title: Understand Discounting and Temporal Difference Learning
subgoals.description: Learn about the concepts of discounting future rewards and how Temporal Difference (TD) learning algorithms update value estimates.

tasks.description: Explain the purpose of the discount factor (gamma) and its impact on learning.
Understand how TD learning algorithms update value estimates based on observed rewards.
Differentiate between different TD learning methods, such as TD(0), TD(lambda), and Monte Carlo methods.
Explain the concept of bootstrapping in TD learning.
